title: Penny Lancaster wears safari print bikini on Tanzania holiday
text:
Penny Lancaster said she felt like she was 'in heaven' as she soaked up the sun in Tanzania on Thursday.

The Loose Women panellist, 48, looked incredible as she showed off her age-defying figure in a tiny safari print bikini while in the infinity pool of their luxury villa.

Penny is currently on the trip of a lifetime with husband Rod Stewart, 74, and sons Aiden, eight, and Alastair, 13, and has been sharing a slew of snaps on Instagram.

Sizzling display: Penny Lancaster said she felt like she was 'in heaven' as she showed off her incredible bikini body while soaking up the sun in Tanzania on Thursday

For her latest sizzling post, Penny stripped down to her plunging halterneck bikini which was adorned with a leafy green and black print.

The television presenter, who rose to fame as a model, proved she had still got it as she flaunted her taut stomach and long legs while floating in the pool.

She captioned the post: 'I think I’m the closest to heaven I’ve ever been #tanzania #singita.'

' I don't want to leave': After the refreshing dip the family gathered around a fire pit to watch the sunset over the plains of Africa

Romantic: In one loved-up photo, Rod and Penny wrapped their arms around each other as they took in the breathtaking views by a log fire

After the refreshing dip the family gathered around a fire pit to watch the sunset over the plains of Africa.

In one loved-up photo, Rod and Penny wrapped their arms around each other as they took in the breathtaking views by a log fire.

Penny told her fans she 'didn't want to leave' because the family were having so much fun.

Adventure: Penny looks to be having the time of her life as she shared several more snaps from her holiday of a lifetime

It comes after the former model took to Instagram and showed her followers what the couple have been up to on the excursion where they have been spending time soaking up the culture of the local Massai people.

The couple have been going on the Legendary Expeditions safari with Penny sharing a snap next to man who she called her 'Massai warrior' in the caption.

Penny also shared several snaps of herself standing next to a group of Massai women.

She wrote: 'Sharing my photos that I took of the girls. I could have spent the whole day with them.'

The TV star and her rock star husband took part in some local activities as part of their tour with Penny sharing a video of herself taking part in a dance with a large group of women.

Rod also shared a photo to his Instagram and told how he was relishing the couple's trip.

Trip: Penny took to Instagram and showed what the couple have been up to on the excursion where they have been spending time soaking up the culture of the local Massai people

'Verified Humbled by the warmth of the local Maasai tribe in one of the family homes,' he wrote.

Rod and Penny have been exploring the Serengeti from the comfort of the luxurious Mwiba Lodge, set in a private 51,000-acre wildlife reserve.

The couple shared a number of pictures showing the whole family - including sons Aiden, and Alastair - immersing themselves in local customs, as well as making the most of the exclusive setting.

The five star lodge gives guests the opportunity to see wildlife as well as cultural experiences, giving you access to four different Tanzanian tribal communities.

Culture: Penny shared a video of herself taking part in a dance with a large group of women

Penny wrote: 'Sharing my photos that I took of the girls. I could have spent the whole day with them'

Holiday: Rod also shared a photo to his Instagram and told how he was relishing the couple's trip

Featuring 10 rented suites laid out in a semi-circular formation and connected by wooden walkways, there is also a spa and swimming pool on site.

Prices for a double room with an all-inclusive stay are in the $1,000 (£769) to $1,250 (£962) range per person in low season.

Penny shared: 'Learning the ways of the Mwiba tribe #legendaryexpeditions #tanzania'.

She also encountered an elephant while on safari, sharing a beautiful photo of the animal in the wild.

'This elephant is know by the locals as One & a half for his shorter left tusk. He is one of the more elderly of the herd and therefore not in contention for breading so is free to wonder far from the herd. #mwibalodge #tanzania', she wrote.

African adventure: Penny and Rod have been exploring the Serengeti from the comfort of the luxurious Mwiba Lodge

Photo album: The couple shared a number of pictures showing the whole family - including sons Aiden and Alastair - immersing themselves in local customs

Up close and personal: Penny also came close to an elephant while on safari, sharing a beautiful photo of the animal in the wild

Luxury accommodation: The five star lodge gives guests the opportunity to see wildlife as well as cultural experiences, giving you access to four different Tanzanian tribal communities

Sir Rod is no doubt enjoying every moment after receiving the all-clear from prostate cancer in July following a secret three-year battle with the disease.

Speaking recently on Loose Women, a visibly emotional Penny recalled: 'He's very up on his health. He doesn't believe in retirement, he wants to keep going forever, so he's always getting screenings and tests...

'It's emotional. We kept it quiet for two and a half years now. The positive news is we caught it early enough.'

Detailing the gruelling radiation treatment the Maggie May singer underwent to beat the disease, she said: 'Rod and I were travelling into London at the same time every single day, going to the clinic.

Brave: Penny broke down in tears as she discussed Rod's battle with an 'aggressive' form of prostate cancer during a recent episode of Loose Women

'Rod's never done one day, one week the same ever in his entire life. He put his positive head on, along with myself. The nurses had a little room for him. He took his computer, he said this was like my day in the office.'

Rod - who also has adult children Sarah Streeter, Kimberly Stewart, Sean Stewart, Ruby Stewart, Renée Stewart and Liam Stewart from previous relationships - and Penny decided not to tell his two youngest children until after he was given the all-clear.

She said: 'We told the older ones. Aidan was only five or six so wasn't old enough to understand. It would be too much for them [the younger ones] to understand.

'When daddy finally told everybody the good news, and to get the message out there for guys out there over 50 go and get the test, then we told the little ones.'
description: Penny Lancaster said she felt like she was 'in heaven' as she showed off her incredible bikini body while soaking up the sun in Tanzania on Thursday.
